findings.title: Potential Reentrancy Risk in sendCollateral()
findings.description: Violation of `checks-effects-interactions` principle in `sendCollateral()` function, potentially leading to reentrancy attacks.

findings.title: Improved WETH Input Amount in _adjustArray()
findings.description: The `_adjustArray()` function does not correctly update the input amount of `WETH`.

findings.title: Revised Collateral Priority Update in setCollateralPriority()
findings.description: In the `ERD` protocol, the `CollateralManager` contract maintains a list of the supported collaterals and their parameters. The collaterals are sorted in descending order per their priorities. However, there is a logical issue that may mess up the collaterals priority order and their parameters.

findings.title: Revised Transfer Validation in EToken::transferFrom()
findings.description: Logic issue in transfer validation may permit forbidden transfers or block permitted ones.

findings.title: Revised Shares Update in EToken::transfer()
findings.description: The share balance update in EToken transfer does not add the corresponding share amount to the recipient’s share balance.

findings.title: Timely Price Update in validAdjustment()
findings.description: The `collateralManager.validAdjustment()` routine does not update prices via the `priceFeed` for all collaterals before using the last good prices, which may be out of date without an initiative price update request to the oracle.

findings.title: Revised EUSD Amount to Mint in _mintToTreasury()
findings.description: In the ERD protocol, the trove owner has to pay a low interest for the trove debt. The interest that is accumulated by a trove from the last operation to the present will be minted to the treasury. However, we notice the EUSDToken contract implements a standard ERC20 which has no special processing for the liquidityIndex. As a result, the treasury actually receives a scaled token balance which may be less than the minted amount.

findings.title: Trust Issue on Admin Keys
findings.description: In the ERD protocol, there is a privileged account, i.e., `owner`, that plays a critical role in regulating the protocol-wide operations and has extra power to set protocol contracts addresses, add/remove collateral, set collateral priority, pause/unpause a collateral, etc.
